title: How to Enable Steam's In‐Game FPS Counter

steps.headline: Click Steam menu in the menu bar present at the top.
Click "Settings" option from the drop-down list.
Click the "In-Game" option from the side bar in the settings window.
steps.description: Here you can see that there is an in-game FPS counter drop down list box with default value "Off".

steps.headline: Click the "In-Game FPS Counter" drop-down list.
steps.description: By default it is off, so switch it on by taking the specifying the position at which the FPS should be displayed.

steps.headline: Start the game.
steps.description: The FPS is displayed at the position you have specified.

text: Open Steam.  Click Steam menu in the menu bar present at the top.  Click "Settings" option from the drop-down list.  Click the "In-Game" option from the side bar in the settings window. Here you can see that there is an in-game FPS counter drop down list box with default value "Off". Click the "In-Game FPS Counter" drop-down list. By default it is off, so switch it on by taking the specifying the position at which the FPS should be displayed. Click OK.  Start the game. The FPS is displayed at the position you have specified.
